Rudradaman I

The Sakas controlled a larger territory than the Greeks. The most famous Saka ruler was Rudradaman I (c. 130тАУ150 CE), who repaired the Sudarshana Lake in Kathiawar (Junagadh inscription - the first pure Sanskrit inscription). There were 5 branches of the Sakas, of which the Western Satraps lasted the longest.
